FINANCE SPECIALIST

SUMMARY

Strategic Finance & Accounting Professional with experience in extensive contracts analytics, financial statement reporting, budget optimization and customer service.
Financial skill set attributes of keen attention to line itemization, deadline committed, and a dedicated business partner to internal and external customers to ensure optimal organizational objectives are met.
Highlights
Credit & Accounts Payables/Receivables Management Pricing and Cost Reduction Strategies Finance & Procurement Forecasting (Volume & Dead Net Gross Profit)
P&L Reporting Trade Spend & Marketing Budgets Contract Management & Risk Analysis Financial & Business Planning Analysis
Career Accomplishments
Formally recognized by National Account Executives for excellence in financial analysis, budgeting, forecasting, and customer service.
Achieved 10% pricing submission reduction, by eliminating pricing resubmissions & creating departmental Pricing Authorization Training Guide.
Reduced system liability through identification of checkbook percentages of volume conversions.
Created a checkbook Reconciliation process & training guide.
Reduced invoice processing down to 10 days.
Pilot for customer mass data uploads.
Territory Divestiture Collaboration process & restated volume file creation.

EXPERIENCE

Managed $87.6M Trade Spend & Cooperative Trade Marketing annual budget for Drug/Value supply chain customers Reconciled invoices and post audits to 1010 Scan Data by package level reducing trade spend checkbook variances to scanned units by 10% in 18 month period.
Customer facing experience (Rite Aid, Dollar Tree, Freds, Variety Stores, Big Lots, Aldi).
Managed Checkbook Accruals and Spends entries for Trade Fund and Marketing Funding.
Monthly Bottler Pricing analysis to identify discrepancies of Accrual rates, Dead Net Sales Income (DNNSI), and Volumes of Package/Brand Categories.
Summarized and interpreted key business indicators and provided recommendations to Executive Leadership and Non-Financial managers that facilitated timely and impactful business decisions on forecasting and financial statement reporting gaps.
Prepared Regional and National month end checkbook to accounts payable reconciliation and Ad Hoc reporting (P&L, Rolling estimates, and overspend projections on planned promotional activities).
Assisted in departmental key productivity initiatives such as implementation of a standardize forecast model, developed a checkbook reconciliation process, and discovered volume conversion percentages driving checkbook reporting accuracy variances.
Submitted National retail account supply chain Pricing (PAT) and performed weekly Sarbanes Oxley (Sox) compliance reviews.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Data Quality & Analytics AVP 

Location: New York City Metropolitan Area

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Other

Description:
The Data Quality & Analytics AVP will be part of the team supporting the bank-wide data management programs, especially on data/business analytics, and improving business results through the usage of data across the organization.
Job ResponsibilitiesInclude but are not limited to
Data AnalyticsDomain Understanding: Work closely with business teams to understand their specific domains and data requirements. Formulate data needs based on business context and objectives.Data Source Identification and Quality Analysis: Identify relevant data sources and conduct data quality assessments, data issue root cause analysis, and propose remediation solutions.Automated Data Scraping and Standardization: Develop automated processes for data extraction and scraping (with IT support). Cleanse and standardize data to ensure accuracy and consistency.Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA): Analyze complex datasets to uncover trends, patterns, and anomalies. Provide actionable insights to stakeholders.BI Reports Development: Utilize Business Intelligence tools (e.g., Qlik Sense) to build dashboards with visualizations to monitor performance and other business purposes.Presentation and Communication: Create compelling presentation decks using tools like PowerPoint to present data analysis results to business leaders and management effectively.
Data Analytics Education, Communications and GuidanceAdvocacy and Education:Promote data analytics practices and technology adoption within the organization.Training Development: Contribute to the development and execution of educational programs on data analytics.
Job RequirementsBachelor’s degree required, Master’s degree preferredA minimum of 2 years of experience in the Financial Services Industry focusing on data and at least 3 years of professional experience in Data Analytics related, Content-centric/data-centric roles requiredAt least 3 years of experience in SQL and Business Intelligence / Data Visualization tools requiredProficiency in SQL (e.g., dynamic SQL, stored procedures, process automation), Statistical Packages (e.g., Python) for analyzing datasets, Business Intelligence tools (e.g., Qlik Sense，Tableau, Power BI) for visualization is a mustStrong analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy is neededExcellent communication and presentation abilities requiredKnowledge of regulatory/compliance and risk management requiredKnowledge and experience in project management required
The salary range for the AVP position is $65,000-$150,000 per year. Actual salary is commensurate with candidate’s relevant years of experience, skillset, education and other qualifications.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
